ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class taught me how to become a much better writer and critical thinker. Additionally, the class drew my attention to the prevalence of religion in the sci fi genre.
I learned a lot of new things about religions including my own.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The biggest strength of the course come from the amount of interesting full length novels/works of other mediums that we had a chance to examine throughout the seminar.
Very interesting content via the books covered.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would 100% recommend any incoming freshman to take this class. Professor Doerfler was an amazing professor to learn with and she gives you all the tools you need to succeed in college. Additionally, the works that we read were extremely interesting and have become some of my favorite novels Ive recently read. Even though Im planning to be a stem major, I still loved this class so much and am glad that I took it. The only people I wouldnt recommend the class to are those who cant handle a lot of reading. While the readings are fantastic, there are a lot with it not being uncommon to have a week or less to finish a full length book.
Yes. Very interesting topics covered and a great professor
